law.catch_line: Descent Of Estates Of Persons Born Out Of Wedlock
law.text: [ Text of section effective until March 31, 2012. Repealed by 2008, 521, Sec. 7. See 2008, 521, Sec. 44 as amended by 2010, 409, Sec. 23 and 2011, 224.] If a person born out of wedlock dies intestate, such estate shall pass in accordance with the law of intestate succession except that the father and his kindred shall not be considered as relatives of the child born out of wedlock unless the child might have inherited from the father as provided in section seven.
